objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: Author and publisher of the report; credited as the author of the included YARA and SIGMA rules.

objects.name: Devil Bait C2 domain
objects.description: Primary C2 infrastructure used for download, exfiltration, and beaconing over HTTP.

objects.name: Embedded VBScript domain
objects.description: Domain contacted by embedded VBScript to fetch and execute returned content.

objects.name: Second-stage download URL
objects.description: Hardcoded GET endpoint used to retrieve the second-stage VBScript from C2.

objects.name: Exfiltration URL
objects.description: Hardcoded POST endpoint used to upload encoded system enumeration data (1.txt).

objects.name: Beaconing URL
objects.description: URL fetched by scheduled task via mshta.exe every 10 minutes for onward tasking.

objects.name: Embedded VBScript URL
objects.description: Document-embedded VBScript connects here and executes the response body.

objects.name: Embedded domain URL
objects.description: Base domain URL referenced by the embedded VBScript in the malicious document.

objects.name: First-stage VBScript on disk
objects.description: Stage-1 VBScript written by the macro and executed via wscript.exe.

objects.name: System enumeration output file
objects.description: Collected system information is appended here before encoding and exfiltration.

objects.name: Encoded exfiltration data file
objects.description: Base64-encoded (certutil) system enumeration data prior to exfiltration.

objects.name: IE DisableFirstRunCustomize key
objects.description: Modified by embedded VBScript to prevent IE first-run customization.

objects.name: IE Check_Associations key
objects.description: Modified by embedded VBScript to prevent IE default browser check.

objects.name: Indicator for 체불확인원-김보라.doc (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of malicious macro-enabled Microsoft Word document (Devil Bait).

objects.name: Indicator for 체불확인원-김보라.doc (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of malicious macro-enabled Microsoft Word document (Devil Bait).

objects.name: Indicator for 체불확인원-김보라.doc (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of malicious macro-enabled Microsoft Word document (Devil Bait).

objects.name: Indicator for data.txt (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of second-stage malicious VBScript retrieved from C2.

objects.name: Indicator for data.txt (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of second-stage malicious VBScript retrieved from C2.

objects.name: Indicator for data.txt (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of second-stage malicious VBScript retrieved from C2.

objects.name: devil bait
objects.description: Devil Bait is a malicious macro-enabled Microsoft Word document targeting Korean speakers that downloads and executes a second-stage VBScript via HTTP using MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP. Both stages live off the land, leveraging Windows binaries for execution, system enumeration, registry modification, persistence, and command-and-control. The first-stage VBA writes and runs version.xml (VBScript) with wscript.exe, which retrieves the second stage from www.hahae.co[.]kr. The second stage enables Microsoft Office macros by default via registry edits, performs system and directory enumeration (systeminfo, ipconfig /all, tasklist, directory listings), writes results to sr011.xml, base64-encodes them with certutil.exe into conv.xml, and exfiltrates the data as 1.txt over HTTP. Persistence is achieved by creating a scheduled task named AhnlabUpdate that beacons every 10 minutes to fetch and run remote content via mshta.exe. Additional embedded VBScript modifies Internet Explorer settings and uses InternetExplorer.Application to fetch and execute code. The persistence mechanism masquerades as AhnLab.

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
objects.description: Devil Bait uses the WScript shell from within other scripts to spawn cmd.exe instances to collect system information.

objects.name: Scheduled Task/Job: Scheduled Task
objects.description: Devil Bait creates a Scheduled Task to beacon every 10 minutes.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: Devil Bait Command and Control is achieved over HTTP using the scripting object ServerXMLHTTP.

objects.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
objects.description: Devil Bait sends system enumeration data over HTTP to the C2 server.

objects.name: Masquerading: Match Legitimate Name or Location
objects.description: Devil Bait masquerades as AhnLab, a legitimate security product, in its persistence mechanism.

objects.name: AhnLab
objects.description: Legitimate South Korean endpoint security product that Devil Bait impersonates (e.g., scheduled task named AhnlabUpdate) for persistence.

objects.name: VirusTotal
objects.description: Service referenced as the source of sandbox data used to retrieve the second-stage VBScript and for retro-hunts and pivoting to identify variants.

objects.name: Microsoft
objects.description: Vendor of Microsoft Word, Windows, Office, and Internet Explorer—products abused by the malware for macro execution, COM automation, registry changes, and living-off-the-land techniques.

objects.name: Kimsuky
objects.description: Referenced as an actor group that has previously used the technique of masquerading as AhnLab for persistence and the use of 'Update' in autorun names (e.g., AhnlabUpdate). No direct attribution of Devil Bait is made in the report.

objects.name: DevilBait_vbscript_2
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_vbscript_2 {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "These strings appear in second stage VBScript used
by Devil Bait."

    strings:
       $ = "WScript.Shell" nocase
       $ = "Scripting.FileSystemObject" nocase
       $ = "MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP.6.0" nocase
       $ = "FolderExists" nocase
       $ = "certutil" nocase
       $ = "vbCrLf" nocase
       $ = "expandenvironmentstrings" nocase
       $ = "%appdata%" nocase
    condition:

    filesize < 20KB and all of them

}

objects.name: DevilBait_Maldoc
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_Maldoc {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "These strings appear in the Devil Bait malicious
document."

    strings:

   $word = "MSWordDoc"
   $ms_xml = "MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP.6.0"
   $ = {53 65 6E 64 3A 45 78 65 63 75 74 65 28 [1-6] 2E 72 65 73 70

6F 6E 73 65 54 65 78 74 29}// Send:Execute(<variable>.responseText)

   $ = "wscript.exe //e:vbscript"

    condition:

    all of them

}

objects.name: DevilBait_C2
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_C2 {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "C2 and IoC strings found in Devil Bait second
stage vbscript."

    strings:
       $file_1 = "sr011.xml"

       $must_func = "Roller"
       $must_C2 = ".co.kr"

       $c2_1 = "cross.php"
       $c2_2 = "report.php"
       $c2_3 = "list.php"
       $c2_4 = "show.php"
    condition:
        $file_1 and any of ($must_*) and any of ($c2_*)
}

objects.name: DevilBait_vbscript_1
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DevilBait_vbscript_1 {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule identifies the first stage vbscript
written to disk e.g. version.xml."

    strings:
        $must_1 = "On Error Resume Next:Set"
        $must_2 = "CreateObject(\"MSXML2.ServerXMLHTTP.6.0\"):"
        $must_3 = ".Send:Execute("
        $must_4 = "http"
        $get = "GET"
        $post = "POST"
    condition:

    filesize < 10KB and all of ($must*) and ($get or $post)

}

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Devil Bait
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. devil bait.
